text: Nathaniel Raphael Jones (May 12, 1926 â€“ January 26, 2020) is an American judge and politician. He was a United States Circuit Judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit before his retirement in March 2002. He was general counsel of the NAACP. Jones was nominated by President Jimmy Carter on August 28, 1979, to a seat vacated by John Weld Peck. He was confirmed by the United States Senate on October 4, 1979, and received commission on October 5, 1979. He was promoted to senior status on May 13, 1995. Jones retired from the bench on March 30, 2002. Jones died on January 26, 2020 in Cincinnati, Ohio at the age of 93 from congestive heart failure. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from congestive heart failure Category:American judges Category:Politicians from Cincinnati Category:Politicians from Youngstown, Ohio Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Lawyers from Cincinnati
title: Nathaniel R. Jones
